meanings.definition: Covered in fuzz or fuzz-like material.
meanings.sent1: The peach was fuzzier than the smooth apple.
meanings.sent2: The teddy bear's fuzzy coat made it look even fuzzier.
meanings.sent3: The fuzzy blanket became even fuzzier after being washed.
meanings.sent4: The fog made the distant trees look fuzzier, like a watercolor painting.
meanings.sent5: The kitten's fur was so fuzzy that it seemed even fuzzier under the sunlight.

meanings.definition: Not clear or distinct; blurred or indistinct.
meanings.sent1: Her memory of the dream became fuzzier as the day went on.
meanings.sent2: The old photograph was getting fuzzier with each passing year.
meanings.sent3: The unclear instructions made the situation even fuzzier.
meanings.sent4: The mist made the outline of the mountain fuzzier, like a dream fading away.
meanings.sent5: The distant figure became fuzzier in the fog, disappearing into the haze.

meanings.sent1: The writing on the old sign was getting fuzzier over time.
meanings.sent2: His memory of the event was becoming fuzzier as the days passed.
meanings.sent3: The details of the story became fuzzier as he tried to recall them.
meanings.sent4: The colors of the painting were blending together, becoming fuzzier.
meanings.sent5: The boundaries between the two colors were getting fuzzier, creating a gradient effect.
